intro: Hieracium pseuderectum, commonly known as the false upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with upright stems and basal leaves that are usually heart-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium pseuderectum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
